newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya tea prices firm overall on improved demand.
newsitem.headline: Kenya tea prices firm overall on improved demand.

text.p: Kenyan tea prices were seen firm overall on improved and strong general demand at the Mombasa weekly tea auction on Monday, auction officials said.

Brighter and medium BP1s appreciated by 2-4 U.S cents while lower mediums gained 3-6 cents. Brightest PF1s were firm to 3 cents dearer while other brighter sorts were barely steady. PDUSTs and DUST1s were a strong feature.
In the secondary catalogues selected lines of Fannings were dearer.
Pakistan was forceful while there was improved and strong interest from Egypt.
